Name: Seated Statue of the Goddess Isis
Description: This statue of the goddess Isis was found in the tomb of the chief scribe, Psammetik, at Saqqara. It depicts the wife of the great god Osiris and the mother of Horus, as a beautiful woman.Isis holds the Ankh sign, symbol of life. Since Isis was often associated with the goddess Hathor, she wears a crown similar to hers consisting of a solar disk between two cow horns. The base of the statue contains an offering formula dedicated by Psammetik to Isis, goddess of charm, who succeeded in resurrecting her husband Osiris after he was killed by his brother Seth.
